name: Memorial Park - Santa Monica
description:
There are two entities that operate at Memorial Park: the Santa Monica Pickleball Club (SMPC), a non-profit club; and the City of Santa Monica. 

There is pickleball play every day, but the only set schedules are these:

The Club’s Open Play (free): 
M-F, 8 AM-12 PM 

The City’s Drop-In Program (pay-to-play):
M/W night: 5 PM-9:30 PM
Sat/Sun: 8 AM-11 AM; 11:15 AM-2 PM
open_play_schedule: See City of Santa Monica website for latest. Drop-In Pickleball is M and W, 5 - 9:30pm; S and Su, 8am to 2pm.

name: Pickleball Badminton Center
description:
Our recently inaugurated pickleball facility, located in the delightful city of Lakewood near Long Beach Airport, is approaching its two-month anniversary. We take pride in offering five indoor courts equipped with joint-friendly cushioning to minimize the risk of injuries. Please don't hesitate to contact us for additional information. You can find us at 3699 Industry Ave, Lakewood, California.

Walk-ins are welcome, and the fee is $10 for individuals aged 64 and below, $5 for seniors aged 65 and above, and complimentary for active police and fire personnel. Indoor court shoes are mandatory, and if you don't have your own, we provide shoe rentals at $5 per pair. For those seeking exclusive court time, you can gather a group of up to 8 players for a rate of $30 per hour per court.
Come rain or shine, we eagerly anticipate welcoming all pickleball enthusiasts to our venue!

name: Warner Center Pickleball
description:
The only dedicated Pickleball Club in the San Fernando Valley. Instructional Academy with classes, drilling, and clinics for everyone from 1st time players to Pros.

Membership is FREE as a Walk-In member and you only pay when you play.
address: 6336 Canoga Ave. 7th Floor Rooftop Tennis Center
open_play_schedule: More options available. Check our Website for full schedule and fees.
fees: Fee required — $15 per person for open play during the week, and $20 on the Weekends.  Unlimited Open play membership is available for $179/month.

name: WeHo Rooftop
description: WeHo Rooftop is one of the most popular places to play pickleball in West Hollywood, CA. There are 6 outdoor asphalt courts. The lines are permanent, and portable nets are available. The courts can be reserved. A one-time fee is required to play. The facility includes amenities like lights, water, restrooms, and trainers or lessons.
open_play_schedule: Must be booked through playbypoint.com under "Tennacity at West Hollywood: West Hollywood Park."

name: Westchester LA Pickleball
description: Courts for pickleball are temporarily closed for renovation

name: Westchester Recreation Center
description: Come play pickleball at Westchester Recreation Center in Los Angeles, CA! There are 8 outdoor hard courts. The lines are permanent, and portable nets are available. A one-time fee is required to play.

name: West Coast Pickleball - Pomona/Chino
description: West Coast Pickleball - Pomona/Chino is a place to play pickleball in Pomona, CA. There are 10 asphalt and concrete courts. 1 is outdoors and 9 are indoors. These are dedicated courts with permanent lines and nets. A one-time fee is required to play. Players have access to water, youth programming, lights, a pro shop or equipment store, trainers or lessons, wheelchair accessibility, adaptive programming, restrooms, food, and locker rooms. You can reserve the courts.
fees: Fee required — Membership not required to play, Open to the public

name: Westdrift Manhattan Beach
description: Westdrift Manhattan Beach is a place to play pickleball in Manhattan Beach, CA. There are 4 outdoor asphalt courts. These are dedicated courts with permanent lines and nets. A one-time fee is required to play. The facility includes amenities like a pro shop or equipment store, restrooms, water, and food. You can reserve the courts.
open_play_schedule: To Check In for PickleBall, please go to the Golf Shack.

name: West End Racquet & Health Club
description: West End Racquet & Health Club is a place to play pickleball in Torrance, CA. There are 4 outdoor concrete courts. These are dedicated courts with permanent lines and nets. Players have access to lights, water, restrooms, locker rooms, and food. A membership is required to play.

name: Westlake Athletic Club
description: Come play pickleball at Westlake Athletic Club in Westlake Village, CA! There are 8 outdoor hard courts. These are dedicated courts with permanent lines and nets. A membership is required to play. Players have access to restrooms, food, water, and lights.

name: Westlake Village Community Park @ YMCA
description: Westlake Village Community Park @ YMCA is a place to play pickleball in Westlake Village, CA. There are 4 outdoor hard courts. These are dedicated courts with permanent lines and nets. You can’t reserve the courts. The facility includes amenities like lights. The courts are free.

name: Westwood Community Park
description: Come play pickleball at Westwood Community Park in Westwood, CA! There are 2 outdoor courts. The lines are permanent, and portable nets are available. The courts are free.

name: Whaley Park
description: Whaley Park is one of the most popular places to play pickleball in Long Beach, CA. There is 1 outdoor hard court. The lines are permanent, but you'll need to bring your own net. The court is free.

name: Wheeler Park
description: Wheeler Park is one of the most popular places to play pickleball in Claremont, CA. There are 5 outdoor concrete courts. These are dedicated courts with permanent lines and nets. The courts are free. Amenities include restrooms, water, wheelchair accessibility, and lights.

name: William J. McAdam Park
description: Come play pickleball at William J. McAdam Park in Palmdale, CA! There are 12 outdoor hard courts. These are dedicated courts with permanent lines and nets. The courts are free. You can’t reserve the courts. Amenities include restrooms.

name: Wolf & Bear Pickleball
description: Wolf & Bear Pickleball is a place to play pickleball in Los Angeles, CA. There are 13 indoor acrylic courts. These are dedicated courts with permanent lines and nets. A one-time fee is required to play. You can reserve the courts. Players have access to restrooms, youth programming, a pro shop or equipment store, lights, trainers or lessons, adaptive programming, and water.
fees: Fee required — $50.00 per hour durning prime hours & $40.00 per hour durning off-peak hours

name: Woodland Hills Pickleball
description: Woodland Hills Pickleball is a place to play pickleball in Los Angeles, CA. There are 2 outdoor courts. The lines are permanent, and portable nets are available. The courts are private. You can reserve the courts.
fees: Private — $25 per hour up to 4 people per court. We have 2 courts so can have up to 8 people total for $50 per hour.

name: Xisle Sports
description: Come play pickleball at Xisle Sports in Los Angeles, CA! There is 1 outdoor concrete court. The lines are overlaid on a tennis court, so the net is a little taller than a normal pickleball net. Players have access to lights. A one-time fee is required to play. The court can be reserved.
